newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Glaxo hits N.Y. high.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Glaxo hits N.Y. high.

text.p: British drug company Glaxo Wellcome Plc rose to a 12-month record in New York on Tuesday, boosted by results and ratings upgrades.
Traders said American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) in European companies were seeing revived interest from U.S. buyers who had been evaluating their holdings after a run-up at the start of the year.
"I think people are coming back in, but they are picking companies now and not countries and sectors," a trader said. He added that ADRs were being helped by overall rises in their home markets.

Glaxo rose one to 37-3/8, a 12-month high, in moderate volume. The company posted strong 1996 results last week and was upgraded by Smith Barney and by Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette on Monday to outperform from underperform.
The pharmaceutical company also was helped by news Sweden had given it approval to market Naramig, a treatment for migraine headaches.
Among other European ADRs, Swedish telecommunications equipment maker LM Ericsson fell 5/8 to 35-1/2.
Analysts have speculated the $2.43 billion merger of Newmont Mining Corp and Santa Fe Pacific Gold Corp will lead to a new wave of takeovers among North American gold mining companies.
Brazilian state telephone company Telebras fell 7/8 to 106-1/8.
Decliners led advancers by 231 to 212 among 806 ADRs. Volume was 22 million shares in late morning.
